attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.effect: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.effect: During your opponent’s next turn, any damage done to Aggron by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Midnight Eyes
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Stadium Power
attacks.effect: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.effect: Look at the top 5 cards of either player’s deck and put them back on top of that player’s deck in any order.

attacks.name: Leaf Bind
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Fang
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Snowstorm
attacks.effect: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Pheromone Stamina
abilities.effect: Nidoking gets +20 HP for each Nidoqueen you have in play.

attacks.name: Venomous Horn
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Dimension Transfer
abilities.effect: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. This power can’t be used if Porygon-Z is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Suspicious Beam β
attacks.effect: If Porygon-Z has no Rainbow Energy attached to it, Porygon-Z does 20 damage to itself and Porygon-Z is now Confused.

abilities.name: Fiery Spirit
abilities.effect: Rapidash can’t be Confused.

attacks.name: Ring of Fire
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

abilities.name: Heal Block
abilities.effect: If you have Lunatone in play, damage counters can’t be removed from any Pokémon (both yours and your opponent’s). (Damage counters can still be moved.)

attacks.name: Sun Flash
attacks.effect: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent’s next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Spooky Whirlpool
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you put Spiritomb from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 6 cards.

attacks.name: Color Tag
attacks.effect: Choose Grass, Fire, Water, Lightning, Psychic, Fighting, Darkness, Metal, or Colorless type. Put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon your opponent has in play of the type you chose.

abilities.name: Poison Moth Wind
abilities.effect: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, your Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can’t be used if Venomoth is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Tangling Tendrils
abilities.effect: As long as Victreebel is your Active Pokémon, your opponent’s Active Pokémon’s Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless more.

attacks.name: Acidic Drain
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned. Remove 3 damage counters from Victreebel.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.effect: Choose 2 cards from your opponent’s hand without looking. Look at the cards you chose, then have your opponent shuffle those cards into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Tail Spank
attacks.effect: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can’t discard 2 cards from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Lost Crush
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.effect: Count the number of cards in your opponent’s hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Legend Ceremony
attacks.effect: Search your deck for both halves of a Pokémon LEGEND, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.effect: Move an Energy card attached to Bronzong to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Saliva Lure
attacks.effect: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.effect: Remove 3 damage counters from Carnivine. The Defending Pokémon can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

abilities.name: Dittobolic
abilities.effect: The number of Benched Pokémon your opponent can have is now 4. If your opponent has 5 Benched Pokémon, your opponent must discard 1 of them and all cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Calming Wind
attacks.effect: Remove all Special Conditions from Dragonite.

attacks.name: Dragon Stamp
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sand Impact
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Fighting Energy attached to Dugtrio. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.effect: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electivire.

attacks.name: Thunder Shot
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent’s Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.effect: As long as Elekid is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Elekid by attacks.

attacks.name: Sparking Ball
attacks.effect: Choose 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Weakness or Resistance. Elekid is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Natural Remedy
abilities.effect: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Golduck, remove 2 damage counters from Golduck.

attacks.name: Powerful Splash
attacks.effect: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Lock
attacks.effect: Your opponent can’t use any Poké-Powers on his or her Pokémon on his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Bench Manipulation
attacks.effect: Your opponent flips a coin for each of his or her Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage times the number of tails. This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Entrancing Melody
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.effect: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent’s). (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Lunatone does 60 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Vital Throw
attacks.effect: You may do 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Machamp does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Hundred Furious Punches
attacks.effect: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Machamp.

attacks.name: Top Burner
attacks.effect: For each Fire Energy attached to Magmortar, discard the top card from your opponent’s deck. Then, flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy attached to Magmortar.

attacks.name: Burst Punch
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.effect: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.effect: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Headwind
attacks.effect: During your opponent’s next turn, the attack cost of each of the Defending Pokémon’s attacks is ColorlessColorless more.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Strip Bare
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent discards all cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.effect: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Sharpedo.

attacks.name: Underwater Dive
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 3 damage counters from Wailord.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.effect: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Wailord. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Wailord, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Search and Invite
attacks.effect: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.effect: You may do 40 damage plus 60 more damage. If you do, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electrode.

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.effect: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Dizzy Punch
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.effect: Lairon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Licking Shot
attacks.effect: Choose 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon for each Energy attached to Lickilicky. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.effect: Remove 2 damage counters from Lickilicky. The Defending Pokémon can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Rendezvous Draw
attacks.effect: Each player draws and reveals the top card of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Distorted Wave
attacks.effect: Before doing damage, remove 1 damage counter from the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knuckle Down
attacks.effect: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.effect: As long as Magby is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Magby by attacks.

attacks.name: Play with Fire
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Magby is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.effect: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bone Impact
attacks.effect: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Mapping
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you play Porygon2 from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: 3-D Attack
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tentavolve
attacks.effect: If Tentacruel evolved from Tentacool during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: CURE
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Attack
attacks.effect: Choose 2 of your opponent’s Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Corrode Target
attacks.effect: Filp a coin. If heads, look at your opponent’s hand, choose 1 card, and discard it.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.effect: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.effect: Switch Yanmega with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Imitate
attacks.effect: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.

attacks.name: Mountain Eater
attacks.effect: Discard the top card of your deck. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Aron.

attacks.name: Inviting Scent
attacks.effect: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Careless Tackle
attacks.effect: Bellsprout does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Bronzor during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.effect: During your next turn, Carvanha’s Bite attack’s base damage is 40.

abilities.name: Lonely Bone
abilities.effect: Any damage done to Cubone by your opponent’s attacks is reduced by 20 for each Marowak in your discard pile (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Sand Veil
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Diglett during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Mini Earthquake
attacks.effect: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.effect: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.effect: Remove 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vulcan Beat
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Volbeat you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.effect: Choose 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Magnetic Switch
attacks.effect: Switch Magnemite with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Friend Search
attacks.effect: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 Pokémon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Pheromone Poison
attacks.effect: If Nidoran♀ is on your Bench, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Messenger
attacks.effect: Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle Pidgey and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.effect: Discard an Energy attached to Porygon and remove 4 damage counters from Porygon.

attacks.name: Tripping Headbutt
attacks.effect: Filp a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon’s attacks. That Pokémon can’t use that attack during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.effect: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Clamp
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sleep Pearl
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wing Flick
attacks.effect: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.effect: Remove from Venomat the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Definding Pokémon.

attacks.name: Illumisile
attacks.effect: If you don’t have Illumise in play, this attack does nothing. Choose 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Firefly Light
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bomb
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.effect: If Yanma has no Energy attached to it, Yanma’s Retreat Cost is 0.

cards.name: Black Belt
cards.effect: You may use this card only if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent. During this turn, each of your Active Pokémon’s attacks does 40 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Indigo Plateau
cards.effect: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can’t play this card.

cards.name: Junk Arm
cards.effect: Discard 2 cards from your hand. Search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. You can’t choose Junk Arm with the effect of this card.

cards.name: Seeker
cards.effect: Each player returns 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. (You return your Pokémon first.

cards.name: Twins
cards.effect: You may use this card only if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent. Search your deck for any 2 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Eye of Disaster
abilities.effect: As long as Absol is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent puts a Basic Pokémon from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vicious Claw
attacks.effect: Choose 1 Pokémon from your hand and put it in the Lost Zone. (If you can’t put a Pokémon in the Lost Zone, this attack does nothing.)

abilities.name: Forest Breath
abilities.effect: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Celebi is your Active Pokémon, you may attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. This power can’t be used if Celebi is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Time Circle
attacks.effect: During your opponent’s next turn, prevent all damage done to Celebi by attacks from your opponent’s Stage 1 or Stage 2 Pokémon.

abilities.name: Energymite
abilities.effect: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. If you do, Electrode is Knocked Out. Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose as many Energy cards as you like and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards. This power can’t be used if Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.effect: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Catastrophe
abilities.effect: As long as Gengar is your Active Pokémon, if any of your opponent’s Pokémon would be Knocked Out, put that Pokémon in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hurl into Darkness
attacks.effect: Look at your opponent’s hand and choose a number of Pokémon you find there up to the number of Psychic Energy attached to Gengar. Put the Pokémon you chose in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.effect: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent’s Pokémon in any way you like.

abilities.name: Fighting Tag
abilities.effect: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Machamp is on your Bench, you may move all Fighting Energy attached to your Active Pokémon to Machamp. If you do, switch Machamp with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crushing Punch
attacks.effect: Discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Champ Buster
attacks.effect: Does 100 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

abilities.name: Magnetic Draw
abilities.effect: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can’t be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Lost Burn
attacks.effect: Put as many Energy cards attached to your Pokémon as you like in the Lost Zone. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards put in the Lost Zone in this way.

abilities.name: Lost Link
abilities.effect: Mew can use the attacks of all of the Pokémon in the Lost Zone (both yours and your opponent’s). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: See Off
attacks.effect: Search your deck for 1 Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Insight
abilities.effect: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent the attack cost of each of Yanmega’s attacks is 0.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.effect: Choose 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.effect: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Lost Crisis
attacks.effect: Choose 2 Energy attached to Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND and put them in the Lost Zone. If any of your opponent’s Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.

attacks.name: Moon’s Invite
attacks.effect: Move as many damage counters on your opponent’s Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent’s other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Sudden Delete
attacks.effect: Choose 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. Put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it back into your opponent’s hand.

attacks.name: Time Control
attacks.effect: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Palkia & Dialga LEGEND. Add the top 2 cards of your opponent’s deck to his or her Prize cards.

cards.name: Alph Lithograph
cards.effect: LOOK AT ALL OF YOUR FACE DOWN PRIZE CARDS!
